etymology.description: phonetic: 又; semantic: 肉 (later written as ⺼); hand shape abstracted to 𠂇.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the hand 又 as the sound component with a flesh/“meat” indicator 肉, later graphically rendered as ⺼, while the hand graph became 𠂇. Early inscriptions may not actually show the meat element, so the common ‘hand holding meat’ story is likely a later reinterpretation rather than the original design.

examples.chinese: 我有两个朋友(我有兩個朋友)。
桌子上有一本书(桌子上有一本書)。
examples.pinyin: Zhuōzi shàng yǒu yī běn shū.
examples.english: There is a book on the table.

examples.chinese: 今天我们有会议(今天我們有會議)。
